榢字的基本解释

榢
jià
古同“架”。

榢字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jià］
［《廣韻》古訝切，去禡，見。］
亦作“榢1”。“枷2”的被通假字。
(1)支承或搁置东西的用具。
(2)物体的构架。
(3)架设，构筑。
(4)谓支起。
(5)重叠，高耸。
(6)超越，胜过。
(7)搀扶。
(8)用强力拖拉；绑架。
(9)驾驶；驾御。
(10)招架，抵挡。
(11)殴打；争吵。
(12)见“架牟”。
(13)捏造，虚构。
(14)法术。古指巫术咒语。
(15)象声词。御者吆喝牲口声。
(16)象声词。见“架架格格”。
(17)量词。两柱之间为一架。
(18)量词。用于有支架的或支架状的东西。
(19)量词。用于骨架。
(20)量词。用于某些机械、乐器等。
(21)量词。方言。用于山。犹座。
(22)量词。方言。用于人。

榢字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　榢； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页543第28
俗架字。

榢字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
榢字的起名意思

暂无。

榢
Basic explanation of words
榢
jià
Gu Tong "shelf".
榢
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jià］
["Guangyun" ancient surprised and cut, go to 禡, see. ]
Also known as "榢1". "Song 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Tools to support or hold things.
(2) The structure of the object.
(3) Erection and construction.
(4) It is called support.
(5) Overlapping and towering.
(6) Transcend and surpass.
(7) Support.
(8) Pull with force; kidnap.
(9) Driving; driving.
(10) Parry, resist.
(11) Assault; quarrel.
(12) See "Jia Mou".
(13) Fabrication, fiction.
(14) Spells. Ancient refers to witchcraft spells.
(15) Onomatopoeia. The royal yelled for cattle.
(16) Onomatopoeia. See "Frame Frame Frame".
(17) Quantifiers. Between the two columns is a frame.
(18) Quantifiers. Used for stents or stent-shaped things.
(19) Quantifiers. Used for skeletons.
(20) Quantifiers. Used in some machinery, musical instruments, etc.
(21) Quantifiers. dialect. Used in mountains. Still seat.
(22) Quantifiers. dialect. Used for people.
榢
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　榢; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 543 28
Common frame word.
榢
Source glyph
Font comparison: Song Ti, Mainland China
Taiwan Minutes
Korean Ming Dynasty
榢
Name meaning
Nothing.
jià
a frame, a stand, a rack. framework or scaffold. to lay on a frame; to put up
